body:
Hi @larroy I think you need to rebase this PR with latest master to make it pass unit tests.
Thanks!

The cpu _backward_dot operator was improved by at least 3x in #8611 
Do you want to sync with master and run it again?
@arank could you help diagnose the issue?
Ok! I will try @eric-haibin-lin
I expect that there are many users of MXNet finding implementation of CapsNet. We're in the middle of implementing data augmentation and will make effort to follow up the accuracy soon.
@cjolivier01 yes, lint is out of date,but fix it not difficulty .

include submodule?
try use vs2015.
synchronization with numpy,stop add new feature when 2019.1.1

I have  update the parameters name and description.
@piiswrong
Current LR example is broken due to the custom op. This is fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/8721.

Ran in to the same problem.
Did some dive into the code and it seems like something with how MXNet handles distributed computation.
bump?
@mli @piiswrong @szha
It should work both way. What's the error that you saw?

This looks good to me. 
nitpick: I will suggest 
```python
has_bias = not param.pop('no_bias', False)
```

You can try help(mx.nd.contrib.MultiBoxPrior) for help info in python. However, I have no idea why the generated function signature are really bad. 
@szha Any clue?
`as_in_context` don't support list of context.
AssertionError: Parameter net0_conv0_weight is missing in file checkpoint\latest-net-0-0.00000.params. Basically, the weights are saved using different name then the load function.

Hi @iblis17 I should be able to help you with this. 
You can ping me on slack at mbaijal.
@anirudh2290

Thank you for fixing this and adding the tests! Yes, since the output stypes which is the in_grads would depend on arguments length and not output length. Can you please let me know what LR example you are referring to?

I see. block.save_params has the option to strip away the network prefix which is on by default. turning it off should fix the problem. Alternatively you can explicitly set the prefix of a block to be empty.
What have you tried to isolate the problem?
I see thanks! Closing issue.
@szha I do not understand the meaning of "isolate the problem". Can you explain it? And Is it OK for you that I have your Wechat or email?

37       118         5568     47.2      3.2          data = np.asarray(data)
    38       118        39818    337.4     23.0          return nd.array(data, dtype=data.dtype

in my project, I also find np to nd is slow.

I am a beginner on mxnet. No idea what I should do when face with such kind of problem.
According to document of **mxnet.image.ImageIter**:
>To load input images from .rec files, use path_imgrec parameter and to load from raw image files, use path_imglist and path_root parameters.

I can load raw image files directly without rec files, that will save me some time when debug my model.

> the imdecoding is always performed on cpu at this time.

Is this documented some where? I can't find it.

I'm not familiar with this model, so I'm trying to help by offering the perspective of how I would approach it.

Have you tried anything to find which parts of the whole pipeline might have problems? For example, are you sure your data pipeline is working correctly? Have you examined samples from your iterator to see if it looks correct? If just using a small subset as training set, does your model overfit to the set?
@anirudh2290 Thanks for your comments. LR example is the `linear_classification.py` in example/sparse.
@KellenSunderland please rebase and resolve conflict.

I just examine the data batch I provide to the model. one of batches looks like below and the next one is its corresponding text version. I can assure you that my data pipeline is working correctly. The data set I use to train the model is the same as used in this paper, and I just want to reproduce this experiment result see whether it really work. I think it is not overfitting cause the training loss and validations loss are both high. I think it's still underfitting. Can you just read this paper to check if my model structure is correct? Cause it is not too complicated and won't take you too much time. maybe about ten minutes at most.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13534043/33006930-47302874-ce07-11e7-95a0-f63d539f30b9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13534043/33006123-19511100-ce04-11e7-9867-7e856d59255c.png)
I still wander whether the way I pad end character is correct ?

I'm asking you to try and overfit a small dataset first as sanity check. If your model can't overfit a small subset of the data, then your model is wrong. This is the first step.

Unfortunately I can't read the paper and reproduce this for you right now.
From the screenshot it looks like the indexing of the text is correct. Do the questions match the input images?

For the text part, you're using end-of-sentence token as the padding, and are unrolling all the way even for paddings. Usually you would want to 1) use a separate token for padding, and 2) minimize the impact of padding by including as little of it as possible. Having these long paddings can impact your text model performance.

I see. Thank you for helping me a lot. My model can overfit this data set. I had record my training loss, it decreases all the time during training process goes, the validation loss however increases after dozens of epochs. I think this is the clue of overfitting. Also, my image feature matches the questions. 
For second way for padding, do you mean I should use bucketing to try it again?
I do not clearly understand the first way you said " use a separate token for padding". What's that mean?
could this new feature support the operation like np.where()？
Problem fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commit/e27f054b4693b556cddb7f7c262651862ca3d02d

1.After updating new codes,the trainning speed is still slowly.
Batchsize is 80000 also,train data size is 100 millions,the same as last testing.
It cost 1977.781s in gpus per epoch,and  cost 2038.416 cpus .
2.I don't t think metric affect the speed,because i have skip the metric during trainning.
3.how can i collect profile log?i'have build it with profile=1,and set export MXNET_PROFILER_AUTOSTART=0,but no profile log are printed on nohup logs.
Is there any other issues that i missed?
@eric-haibin-lin

@szha I'm wondering the same thing: the Convolution op explicitly does not support "NWC", for examlpe, but gluon mentions "NWC" in the docs. Searching the codebase shows that string only occurs in the high-level docs, so are the gluon docs simply wrong here?

@piiswrong We added data augmentation(shifted up to 2 pixels) as on paper, and fixed structure by blocking gradient on both bias(as constant) and inputs_hat before routing ends. Now it achieves test error =0.44% at epoch 40.

This issue is closed due to lack of activity in the last 90 days. Feel free to ping me to reopen if this is still an active issue. Thanks!
Also, do please check out our [forum](https://discuss.mxnet.io/) (and [Chinese version](https://discuss.gluon.ai/)) for general "how-to" questions.

Also, do please check out our [forum](https://discuss.mxnet.io/) (and [Chinese version](https://discuss.gluon.ai/)) for general "how-to" questions.
Regarding mklml_gpu: This is in so far correct that MKLML is built once to include CUDA-support. The binary is being re-used for CPU and GPU tests.

Thanks @eric-haibin-lin for notifying me about https://discuss.mxnet.io/t/c-api-batch-mode/253/1 I will answer this thread later this week.

I have not yet figured out how to publish a sample on github and last weeks busy figuring out how to compile mxnet 0.11 with cpp-package and GPU support, which I recently accomplished.
Also consider splitting up tests like tests/python/unittest and tests/python/train in order to allow parallel execution.
@thirdwing I have distilled the PR to the most important changes and the tests are green; please let me know your thoughts.  Sorry for the confusion about `methods`.  I was mistaken.
@zheng-da Thanks! I have been also assuming the NDArray re-factoring solves this problem. Does the NDArrady refactoring also enable gluon APIs not currently available for CPU? (Inplace operations)
@KeyKy In the report above the overall time is 52.8% in nd.stack function and 23% in nd.array. They are definitely the biggest bottleneck.

Have you tried registering attribute `FResourceRequest` with a vector of two `kTempSpace`s?
For CPU, it's allowed to allocate up to 4 temp memory spaces.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/master/src/resource.cc#L89
why is there no change?
Please do a rebase onto master and rerun tests. PRs cannot be merged without successful tests right now.

The '<eos>' and '<pad>' can be two separate tokens, because they bear different meanings. By using a separate token, your model can learn a new embedding for padding that's different from those of end-of-sentence markers.

Yes, bucketing can indeed help reduce the padding masks.
Close for now.

You can either inject these code into the training loop:
```
    mx.profiler.profiler_set_config(mode='all', filename='profile_output.json')
    mx.profiler.profiler_set_state('run')

    # Code to be profiled goes here...

    mx.profiler.profiler_set_state('stop')

```

or set `MXNET_PROFILER_AUTOSTART=1` to enable auto start for profiling. 

You can post the `xxx_profile.json` file here for us to take a look which part is the bottleneck.
we don't need gradient for now

I overlooked this when merging. But the interface for infer_storage_backward is really bad.
We need to consider reverting the inferstorage PR and redesign the interface
Closing this because we are reverting sparse support for custom op
Do we need to change the tag in install tutorial?

I did what you said, and it still says the output is a list type. And then the concatenation doesn't work. 

```
    # print(internals.list_outputs())
    outputs = internals['resnetv10_flatten0_reshape0_output']
    net_siamese = gluon.SymbolBlock(outputs, inputs, params=resnet.collect_params())
```

```
<type 'list'> <type 'list'>

<NDArray 64x2048 @cpu(0)>]
```

Pinging Eric @piiswrong for this.

@tz-hmc You can still use `concat` for list objects. You can do the following:
```python
inter = mx.nd.concat(*(inter1 + inter2), dim=1)
```

Alright, nevermind. Looks like SymbolBlock returns a list of an NdArray, I think? 
Kept:
`outputs = internals['resnetv10_flatten0_reshape0_output']`

And also did:
```
                inter1 = net_siamese(data1)[0]
                inter2 = net_siamese(data2)[0]
                inter = mx.nd.concat(inter1, inter2, dim=1)
```
Seems to work fine and concatenates.
Thanks!

Autograd and gluon are not tested and looks not supporting MKL. The current re-factoring with MKL storage might help this problem. At least, the debugging will be started based on that re-factoring as a baseline.

@eric-haibin-lin Please create an issue and mention me so I can keep track of this case. I've been thinking about adding a p2/p3-specific job to the Unit Tests - this would cover features which are unsupported by our usual CI-machiens.

Discussed with @jiajiechen: it would be great to not update the existing mxnet symbol. We might end up using it again later on after conversion (in the future).

How to do the "separate token"? This really is my first time hearing about this trick. Could you explain more detail over how to do separate token ""? I really need to solve this problem which I have struggled for several weeks!!  

Thank you so much!
simple, you can just pad the sequences with '<pad>' tokens and put only one '<eos>' before the padding tokens.
I think the performance of `_backward_dot` operator needs to be improved further. I'll keep you posted.

why the image-classification-predict.cc is slow for predict than python and feature_extract.cc?

in image-classification-predict.cc, the most time is located in MXPredGetOutput(with SyncCopyTOcpu)?

Thank you
@idealboy would you create a separate issue for this and include relevant details such as your system and the code?
@ykim362 note this issue happens irrespective of MKL. I.e. it is also present when compiling mxnet without mkl support.

I haven't looked at Amalgamation for android in a while, or run across this issue but from what I can tell it looks like you are missing the library includes in the mxnet_predict-all.cc file that has the utility functions to open file descriptors and link them to objects in memory. https://linux.die.net/man/3/shm_open maybe ensuring the right imports from the man pages here will help.
@reminisce i didnt know we could register a vector of more than 1 with FResourceRequest. Will give this a try. Thank you!

Only touch profile_output.json first,and when run python linear_classification.py , the logs will be writed to 
profile_output.json,But no more logs when the program started to training.
[profile_output.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/files/1489927/profile_output.txt)
Integrated last comments from @piiswrong and merged with 2-bit compression PR (NCCL does not support gradient compression and prints error message when trying to use it).

> New builds of openblas fix the issue.

Which version of openblas?
#8450 was a fix for a problem with the same symptom. Is the problem not fixed even after this PR?
dmlc/mxnet is a mirror of the apache/incubator-mxnet.
Is this ready to go in?  (assuming CI passes)
Pls resolve conflicts
@cjolivier01 As far as I am concerned - yes, it is done. @piiswrong?

I see a lot of gaps between batches. It could be thread scheduling or IO overhead. 
I don't think `export MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS=20` will help. This is useful when you have parallel path in the graph (for example, two operators can be executed at the same time). Maybe setting this to 1 or 2 is good enough. Setting this to a too high value will lead to some overhead. 
`MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS` controls how many operators executed in parallel, while `OMP_NUM_THREADS` controls how many threads run in parallel for any particular operator. 
Could you also run with `MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS=1` and see if there's any IO bottleneck?
I've seen similar issues before. We should keep track of a list of openblas versions that work with MXNet
@bhavinthaker
Yes, we decided to deal with the aggregation policy later

@szha indeed the example provided above works after #8450. I was not careful enough when checking that the issue still persists on master. While this particular issue is fixed there is another regressions with v0.12:


It occurs when extending the example above with a free running decoder which shares its parameters with the original decoder, and using the professor forcing training objective:

```
        with autograd.record():
            output, hidden = self.encoder(data, encoder_begin_state)
            prediction, outputs, decoder_hidden = self.decoder(data, hidden)
            prediction_free, outputs_free, decoder_hidden_free = self.pf_free_decoder(
                data, hidden)

            discriminator_prediction = self.professor_forcing_discriminator(
                outputs_free)
#            l_pf_gan = self.professor_forcing_gan_composable.gan_loss(
#                discriminator_prediction,
#                self.professor_forcing_gan_composable.get_discriminator_label(
#                    data=discriminator_prediction))
            l_ae = self.ae_loss(prediction, expected_label)
            l = l_ae  # + l_pf_gan

```

Uncommenting the lines above will trigger the error. Let me know if you need a self-contained example that triggers the error.

Let me pose an example, 
say I have a question like "What is found on the floor in image1327 ?" and bptt=20, 
then I should turn it into 
```
"What is found on the floor in image1327 ? tokens and put only one ". 
After that, padding with "<eos>" it looks like  below
"What is found on the floor in image1327 ? tokens and put only one <#><#><#><#><#><#>". 
```
Am I right?

better just install via pip if you are not going to modify the source
```pip install mxnet-cu80```

```
What is found on the floor in image1327 ? tokens and put only one <eos> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad>
```
@piiswrong
openblas has plan to release 0.3.0 around December of this year (see xianyi/OpenBLAS#1245)
